title: How to Insert a Background Picture in Word: Full Guide

steps.title: Click Design.
steps.content: Click Design . This tab is in the top-left side of the Word window. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You can use this method to add a background to all pages in a Word document. This feature uses a "watermark", which can be made nearly transparent or fully visible. Transparency works well if you have a specific image, such as a company logo or "Confidential" image, that you want to appear behind the text and objects in your document.

steps.title: Click Watermark.
steps.content: Click Watermark . It's on the top-right side of the Word toolbar near the top of the window. You'll see this option to the left of the "Page Color" and "Page Borders" options.

steps.title: Click Custom Watermark.
steps.content: Click Custom Watermark . This option is near the middle of the "Watermarks" drop-down menu. Clicking it will bring up the "Printed Watermark" window. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the circle next to "Picture watermark".
steps.content: Click the circle next to "Picture watermark". It's near the top of the "Printed Watermark" window.

steps.title: Click Select Picture.
steps.content: Click Select Picture . You'll see this button just below the "Picture watermark" section.

steps.title: Click From a File.
steps.content: Click From a File . This option is at the top of the "Printed Watermark" window. Clicking it will open your computer's default picture storage file (e.g., "Photos") for browsing. You can also choose Web or OneDrive from this menu if you'd rather search for a photo or use one from Cloud storage, respectively.

steps.title: Click a picture.
steps.content: Click a picture. Doing so will select it for your watermark.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. This action will take you back to the "Printed Watermark" window.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . You'll find this at the bottom of the window. Your selected picture will appear as your document's background watermark. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Uncheck the Washout box to prevent your picture from appearing transparent. You can also resize your picture by clicking the "Auto" box and choosing a percentage (e.g., 200).

steps.title: Add text to your document, like usual.
steps.content: Add text to your document, like usual. The watermark will remain in the background of your document, meaning anything you type will remain on top of your selected image. Your text color will also change to stay visible if the picture you chose is too dark or too light to adequately display text. Did you know you can cross out words in your Word document? It’s a great way to indicate a completed or canceled task.

steps.title: Click the Design tab.
steps.content: Click the Design tab. This tab is in the top-left side of the Word window. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Use this method if you want to fill the background of your document with a custom image. This is different from a watermark, which is set to all pages automatically.

steps.title: Click Page Color.
steps.content: Click Page Color . It's in the top-right side of the Word toolbar near the top of the window. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Fill Effects.
steps.content: Click Fill Effects . It's at the bottom of the drop-down menu here.

steps.title: Click the Picture tab.
steps.content: Click the Picture tab. You'll see it at the top of the "Fill Effects" window.

steps.title: Click Select Picture.
steps.content: Click Select Picture . It's near the top of the window.

steps.title: Click From a File.
steps.content: Click From a File . This option is at the top of the "Printed Watermark" window. Clicking it will open your computer's default picture storage file (e.g., "Photos") for browsing. You can also choose Web or OneDrive from this menu if you'd rather search for a photo or use one from Cloud storage, respectively.

steps.title: Select a picture and click OK.
steps.content: Select a picture and click OK . This will select the image in the menu.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . It's at the bottom of the window; doing so will apply your selected picture to your document's background. Unlike with an image watermark, this background picture won't be transparent.

steps.title: Add text to your document, like usual.
steps.content: Add text to your document, like usual. Your text color will change to stay visible if the picture you chose is too dark or too light to adequately display text.

steps.title: Click a color.
steps.content: Click a color. Doing so will apply it to your document's background. If needed, your document's default font color will change in order to stay visible. Now you’re ready to add text, create tables , and format your next paper. If you want to create your own color, click More Colors below the color options here. You'll be able to click and drag a slider around a color gradient to create a custom color. You can also click Fill Effects to add pre-determined textures or patterns to your document's background.

steps.title: Click a watermark template.
steps.content: Click a watermark template. You can select any of the following templates to apply their text to your Word document's background: "CONFIDENTIAL" "DO NOT COPY" "ASAP" "URGENT"

steps.title: Add text to your document, like usual.
steps.content: Add text to your document, like usual. The watermark will remain in the background of your document, meaning anything you type will remain on top of the watermark. You can remove a watermark by clicking Remove Watermark at the bottom of the watermark templates drop-down menu. Don’t forget to occasionally save your Word document to prevent losing any work!

steps.title: Click the Design tab.
steps.content: Click the Design tab. This tab is on the top-left side of the Word window. This method will add your custom text to the background of your document. This is helpful if you want certain text to appear behind the main text and objects in your document, such as your company name or a legal notice.

steps.title: Click Watermark.
steps.content: Click Watermark . It's on the top-right side of the Word toolbar near the top of the window. You'll see this option to the left of the "Page Color" and "Page Borders" options.

steps.title: Click Custom Watermark.
steps.content: Click Custom Watermark . This option is near the middle of the "Watermarks" drop-down menu. Clicking it will bring up the "Printed Watermark" window. [11] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the circle next to "Text watermark".
steps.content: Click the circle next to "Text watermark". It's in the middle-left side of the "Printed Watermark" window.

steps.title: Type your watermark's text into the "Text" box.
steps.content: Type your watermark's text into the "Text" box. This box is near the middle of the window; it should say "ASAP" by default. Your other customization options include the following: Font - The style of text that your watermark uses. Size - Your watermark's size. "Auto", which automatically resizes your text, is the default setting. Color - The watermark's color. Layout - You can click Diagonal or Horizontal here to determine how your watermark is oriented. You can also uncheck the "Semitransparent" box to display your watermark in a bold format.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . You'll find this at the bottom of the window. Your custom text watermark will be applied to your document's background.

steps.title: Add text to your document, like usual.
steps.content: Add text to your document, like usual. The watermark will remain in the background of your document, meaning anything you type will remain on top of your watermark text, even the page numbers .
